name: Old-Time Penny Candy Buttons
author: SHORECOOK
summary: While using royal icing, I saw how it peeled off parchment paper just like the candy buttons from the 1950's. This inspired me to give candy buttons a try.  As a child it was a good buy for a penny, and quantity was important.
ingredients: 1 drop pink, yellow, and blue food coloring paste, or as needed
directions: Cut 10 strips of parchment paper, 2-inches wide by 16-inches long
Sift confectioner's sugar and meringue powder together in a bowl; beat in water and vanilla extract until smooth
Divide sugar mixture evenly into three bowls; beat in small amounts of different food coloring paste into each bowl until desired color has been achieved
Place a #3 pastry tip into end of pastry bag; fill with one of the tinted sugar mixtures
Pipe buttons about the size of a penny onto parchment strips, 3 rows across
Repeat with remaining tinted sugar mixtures
Dry until buttons are hard, about 8 hours
